Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “We’re sad since we just said goodbye to our one friend, and we don’t know if we’re ever going to see her again,”
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: a group of friends who had worked together at a New York summer camp and were traveling together after zigzagging across the country by plane

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: "I have TSA Pre, so that should make it a little easier,"
Unnamed Group of People.Name of Source: Bay Area residents (specifically Katelin Tharp, but the statement could imply a broader group)
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: exemplifying a traveler’s experience with airport procedures during the busy weekend; Katelin Tharp is specifically named but her statement could represent others’ sentiments

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: More than 930,000 travelers will funnel through SFO from Thursday through Tuesday, according to SFO spokesperson Doug Yakel.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: official spokesperson for San Francisco International Airport, providing authoritative information on traveler numbers

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: That’s 8.7% more than last year’s Labor Day weekend.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: same as above; providing context to the increase in traveler numbers

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: This year’s prediction is 97% of what the airport handled five years ago, Yakel said by email.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: same as above; comparing current predictions to pre-pandemic numbers

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: To make it on time, holiday travelers should arrive at the airport two hours before domestic flights and three hours before international ones, Yakel said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: same as above; offering travel advice based on airport expectations

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Yakel said SFO has not been advised of staffing woes for Thursday, which was expected to be the busiest day of travel at the airport.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: same as above; addressing potential concerns about airport staffing

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "I have TSA Pre, so that should make it a little easier,"
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: exemplifying a traveler’s experience with airport procedures during the busy weekend

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We’re sad since we just said goodbye to our one friend, and we don’t know if we’re ever going to see her again,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: sharing personal sentiments after saying goodbye to a friend at the airport, highlighting the human aspect of travel

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A United Airlines spokesperson said the three-hour warning was issued by mistake: somehow the company posted a years-old notice to the Chicago-bound boarding pass.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: official response to a concern about travel advisories, clarifying the mistake

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The spokesperson shared a corrected advisory that suggested passengers “arrive early to avoid delays,” and to get a head start by checking bags from home and leaving luggage in the bag drop shortcut area at the airport.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: same as above; providing updated travel advice to passengers

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Caltrans officials said there are no major projects on the freeways near SFO, so with a bit of luck, drivers headed to the airport shouldn’t face major delays.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: official assurance about road conditions near the airport, impacting travel to SFO
